recipes.title: Freezer Breakfast Burritos (40g Protein)
recipes.description: Meal prep champion! These freezer-friendly breakfast burritos pack 40g protein each. Make a batch on Sunday, reheat all week for a protein-packed breakfast in under 5 minutes.

reheat.duration: 2-3 min from fridge, 4-5 min from frozen
reheat.instructions: Remove foil. Wrap in damp paper towel. Microwave on 50% power.

instructions.text: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook turkey sausage until browned and crumbled, about 8-10 minutes. Season with cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder. Transfer to a large bowl.
In the same skillet, add peppers and onion. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. Add to the bowl with sausage.
Wipe skillet clean, spray with cooking spray. Add egg whites and scramble over medium heat until just set. Season with salt and pepper. Add to bowl.
Add shredded cheese to the bowl. Toss everything together until well combined. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Place about 3/4 cup filling in center of each tortilla. Fold in sides, then roll tightly from bottom to top. Place seam-side down.
Let cool completely. Wrap each burrito tightly in foil. For freezing, place wrapped burritos in freezer bags and label with date.

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Breakfast Bake Squares
recipes.description: Meal prep made easy! These portable breakfast bake squares are loaded with eggs, vegetables, and turkey sausage. Cut into 12 perfect squares for grab-and-go mornings.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375F. Line a 9x13 baking pan with parchment paper and spray with cooking spray.
In a large skillet, cook turkey sausage until browned. Add peppers, onion, and mushrooms. Cook 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Whisk eggs, almond milk, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Spread sausage mixture evenly in prepared pan. Pour egg mixture over top. Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake 35-40 minutes until eggs are set and top is golden. Let cool 10 minutes before cutting into 12 squares.

recipes.title: Egg White Veggie Bites (Starbucks-Style)
recipes.description: Copycat Starbucks sous vide egg bites made with egg whites for maximum protein and minimum calories. Silky, creamy, and perfect for meal prep.

fastFoodClone.originalItem: Egg White & Red Pepper Egg Bites

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325F. Generously grease a 12-cup muffin tin or silicone egg bite mold.
Add egg whites, cottage cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper to a blender. Blend until completely smooth.
Divide roasted peppers, spinach, and cheese evenly among muffin cups.
Pour egg mixture over the vegetables. Bake 25-30 minutes until set and slightly puffed.
Let cool 5 minutes before removing from mold. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: Homemade Turkey Breakfast Sausage Patties
recipes.description: Skip the store-bought sausage and make your own! These lean turkey sausage patties are seasoned perfectly and have 22g protein per serving with minimal fat.

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine all spices and maple syrup.
Add ground turkey to a large bowl. Pour spice mixture over turkey and mix with hands until evenly distributed. Don't overmix.
Divide into 12 equal portions. Form into thin patties about 3 inches in diameter.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties 5-6 minutes per side until internal temp reaches 165F.
Cool completely before storing. Layer with parchment paper in airtight container.

recipes.title: 5-Jar Chia Protein Pudding
recipes.description: Creamy, filling, and loaded with 25g protein per jar. Make all 5 on Sunday night and grab one each morning. No cooking required!
ingredients: Toppings: berries, sliced almonds, coconut flakes

instructions.text: In a large bowl or pitcher, whisk together almond milk, protein powder, maple syrup, vanilla, and salt until protein is dissolved.
Stir in chia seeds and whisk well to prevent clumping.
Pour mixture evenly into 5 mason jars or containers (about 280ml each).
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Chia seeds will absorb liquid and create pudding texture.
Stir before eating. Top with fresh berries, nuts, or coconut flakes.

recipes.title: Savory Protein Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Portable savory muffins packed with eggs, cheese, and vegetables. Perfect for busy mornings when you need protein on-the-go.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350F. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or use silicone liners.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs, milk, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.
Stir in broccoli, bell pepper, sun-dried tomatoes, and half the cheese.
Divide mixture evenly among muffin cups. Top with remaining cheese.
Bake 22-25 minutes until set and golden. Cool 5 minutes before removing.

recipes.title: Soy-Free Vegan Protein Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: A vibrant, creamy smoothie bowl made with pea protein for a soy-free vegan breakfast. Topped with fresh fruit, seeds, and coconut for 30g plant-based protein.
ingredients: Toppings: sliced banana, berries, hemp seeds, coconut flakes, chia seeds

instructions.text: Add frozen bananas, berries, protein powder, coconut milk, and almond butter to a high-speed blender.
Blend until thick and creamy, scraping sides as needed. The consistency should be thicker than a smoothie.
Transfer to a bowl.
Arrange toppings in rows: sliced banana, berries, hemp seeds, coconut flakes, and chia seeds.

recipes.title: Chickpea Flour Breakfast Scramble Wraps
recipes.description: Egg-free scramble made from chickpea flour that tastes remarkably like eggs! Wrapped in a warm tortilla with veggies for a satisfying vegan breakfast.
ingredients: 2g black salt (kala namak) for eggy flavor

instructions.text: Whisk chickpea flour, water, turmeric, black salt, garlic powder, and onion powder until smooth.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Sauté onion until soft, add tomatoes and spinach. Cook until wilted. Set aside.
Pour batter into the same pan over medium heat. As it sets, use a spatula to break it into scramble-like pieces. Cook 8-10 minutes until no longer wet.
Add sautéed vegetables back to the pan and mix with the scramble.
Warm tortillas. Divide scramble between tortillas, roll up, and serve.

recipes.title: High-Protein Overnight 'Oat-Free' Porridge
recipes.description: A grain-free alternative to overnight oats using chia, hemp, and tigernut. Creamy, filling, and packed with 28g protein for those avoiding oats.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine chia seeds, hemp hearts, tigernut flour, protein powder, and cinnamon.
Pour in coconut milk, maple syrup, and vanilla. Whisk until well combined.
Pour into 4 jars or containers.
Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Stir well before eating. Top with fresh fruit, nuts, or seeds.

recipes.title: Protein Granola with Coconut Yogurt
recipes.description: Crunchy homemade protein granola served over creamy coconut yogurt. A satisfying dairy-free breakfast with 26g plant-based protein.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine oats, protein powder, almonds, pumpkin seeds, coconut flakes, cinnamon, and salt.
Drizzle coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla over dry ingredients. Stir until everything is evenly coated.
Spread in an even layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway, until golden brown.
Let cool completely on the pan - it will crisp up as it cools.
Store granola in airtight container. Serve 60g granola over 150g coconut yogurt with fresh berries.

recipes.title: Tofu-Free Mung Bean Scramble
recipes.description: A soy-free alternative to tofu scramble made from sprouted mung beans. Light, fluffy, and packed with complete plant protein.

instructions.text: Drain soaked mung beans. Add to a blender with water and blend until a thick, slightly chunky paste forms.
Add turmeric, black salt, cumin, and garlic powder to the paste. Mix well.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the mung bean mixture.
As the edges set, use a spatula to push and fold the mixture, creating scramble-like pieces. Cook 10-12 minutes until no longer wet.
Add tomatoes and spinach in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Season to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

recipes.title: Egg White & Salsa Breakfast Tacos
recipes.description: Light, fresh, and loaded with 30g protein per serving. These fluffy egg white tacos with fresh salsa are perfect for a quick, low-calorie breakfast.

instructions.text: Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add egg whites, season with salt and pepper. Scramble until just set, keeping them fluffy.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave for 20 seconds.
Divide scrambled egg whites between tortillas. Top with cheese, pico de gallo, avocado slices, and cilantro.
Add hot sauce if desired and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Volume Greek-Style Protein Bowl (Dairy-Free)
recipes.description: A huge, filling breakfast bowl that's only 260 calories but packs 32g protein. Made with dairy-free yogurt alternative for those avoiding dairy.
ingredients: Drizzle of honey or maple syrup (optional)

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir protein powder into yogurt until smooth and creamy.
Top with strawberries, blueberries, and cucumber for maximum volume with minimal calories.
Sprinkle with pumpkin seeds and chia seeds.
Add fresh mint and a light drizzle of honey if desired.

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Protein Scramble
recipes.description: The secret ingredient for the fluffiest, most protein-packed scrambled eggs ever. Cottage cheese adds creaminess and boosts protein to 35g per serving.

instructions.text: Add eggs, egg whites, and cottage cheese to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat.
Pour in egg mixture. Let sit for 30 seconds, then gently push from edges to center with a spatula.
Continue folding gently every 30 seconds. Remove from heat while eggs are still slightly wet - they'll continue cooking.
Season with salt and pepper, top with fresh chives. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: The Lean Breakfast Sandwich
recipes.description: A macro-friendly breakfast sandwich with 38g protein and under 350 calories. Uses an English muffin, egg whites, turkey, and cheese for the perfect balance.
ingredients: Salt, pepper, and hot sauce to taste

instructions.text: Split and toast the English muffin until golden.
Spray a small pan or egg ring with cooking spray. Pour in egg whites, season with salt and pepper. Cook until set, flipping once to form a patty shape.
Briefly warm turkey slices in the same pan.
Layer on bottom muffin: egg white patty, turkey, cheese slice. The heat will melt the cheese.
Add top of muffin, add hot sauce if desired. Wrap in foil for on-the-go.

recipes.title: Fluffy Protein Pancakes
recipes.description: Light, fluffy pancakes with 32g protein per serving. Made with cottage cheese and protein powder for the perfect macro-friendly stack.

instructions.text: Add cottage cheese, eggs, protein powder, oat flour, baking powder, milk, and vanilla to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Let batter rest 5 minutes while you heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.
Pour 60ml batter per pancake onto the pan. Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip carefully and cook another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Stack pancakes, top with sugar-free syrup and fresh berries.

recipes.title: McDonald's Egg McMuffin Clone (40g Protein)
recipes.description: All the nostalgia of the classic McMuffin with MORE THAN DOUBLE the protein. Our version packs 40g protein vs the original 17g - same great taste!

instructions.text: Use a round cookie cutter or egg ring sprayed with cooking oil. Place in a heated pan over medium heat.
Crack whole eggs into a bowl with egg whites, beat lightly. Pour into the ring to create a round patty. Season with salt and pepper. Cook 3 minutes, flip, cook 2 more minutes.
While eggs cook, warm Canadian bacon in the pan.
Toast the English muffin until golden.
Layer: bottom muffin, Canadian bacon, egg patty, cheese (let it melt from egg heat), top muffin.

recipes.title: Starbucks Egg Bites Clone (Double Protein)
recipes.description: Creamy, sous-vide style egg bites just like Starbucks, but with cottage cheese for double the protein. 28g protein per 2-bite serving vs the original 13g.
ingredients: 4 slices turkey bacon, cooked and chopped

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325F. Generously grease a 12-cup silicone egg bite mold or muffin tin.
Add eggs, egg whites, cottage cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to a blender. Blend until completely smooth.
Divide bacon and gruyere evenly among the molds.
Pour egg mixture over the bacon and cheese, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
Cover with foil. Bake 25-30 minutes until set and slightly puffed.
Let cool 5 minutes before removing from molds.

recipes.title: Chick-fil-A Egg White Grill Copycat
recipes.description: Our version of the famous Chick-fil-A Egg White Grill with even MORE protein. 35g vs the original 25g, with a perfectly seasoned chicken patty.
ingredients: 454g (1 lb) chicken breast, ground or finely minced

instructions.text: Mix ground chicken with all seasonings until well combined.
Divide into 4 equal portions and form into thin, round patties slightly larger than the English muffins (they'll shrink).
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Cook patties 4-5 minutes per side until internal temp reaches 165F.
In an egg ring or small pan, cook egg whites into round patties, about 120ml each.
Toast muffins. Stack: bottom muffin, chicken patty, cheese, egg white patty, top muffin.

recipes.title: Panera Power Breakfast Bowl Copycat
recipes.description: A homemade version of Panera's Power Breakfast Bowl with MORE protein and LESS sodium. Fresh, filling, and ready in 15 minutes.
ingredients: Salt, pepper, and everything bagel seasoning

instructions.text: Halve tomatoes, slice avocado, and crumble feta. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan. Add spinach and cook until just wilted. Divide between two bowls.
Whisk eggs and egg whites together. Pour into the same pan and scramble until just set. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide scrambled eggs between bowls over spinach. Add avocado slices, tomatoes, and feta.
Top with fresh basil and everything bagel seasoning.

recipes.title: Fiber Bomb Protein Oatmeal
recipes.description: The ultimate high-fiber, high-protein oatmeal with 30g protein AND 12g fiber per bowl. Keeps you full for hours.

instructions.text: Combine oats, water/milk, cinnamon, and salt in a pot. Cook over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in flaxseed and chia seeds during the last minute of cooking.
Remove from heat. Stir in protein powder until fully incorporated. Add a splash more liquid if too thick.
Transfer to bowl. Top with almond butter and fresh raspberries.

recipes.title: Bean & Egg White Breakfast Burrito
recipes.description: A fiber-rich burrito combining black beans and egg whites for 36g protein and 10g fiber. Satisfying, savory, and perfect for meal prep.
ingredients: 400g (1 can) black beans, drained and rinsed

instructions.text: In a small pot, heat black beans with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Mash slightly for texture.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in egg whites, scramble until just set.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave for 20 seconds each.
Layer on each tortilla: 1/4 of the beans, 1/4 of the egg whites, cheese, and pico de gallo. Roll tightly.
Serve immediately with hot sauce, or wrap in foil for meal prep.

recipes.title: Berry Chia Protein Bowl
recipes.description: A refreshing, antioxidant-rich breakfast bowl with berries, chia seeds, and protein. 26g protein with 9g fiber in every colorful bowl.

instructions.text: In a bowl, stir protein powder into Greek yogurt until smooth.
Stir in chia seeds. Let sit 5 minutes to thicken slightly.
Top with strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries in colorful rows.
Sprinkle with sliced almonds and drizzle with honey if desired.

recipes.title: Savory Oats with Turkey & Spinach
recipes.description: Forget sweet oatmeal - this savory version is topped with ground turkey, spinach, and a runny egg for 38g protein. Comfort food meets gains.

instructions.text: Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add oats, reduce heat, and simmer 5-7 minutes until creamy. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Meanwhile, brown ground turkey in a skillet, breaking into crumbles. Season with salt and pepper.
Add spinach to the turkey and cook until just wilted.
In a separate pan, fry eggs sunny-side up or to your preference.
Divide savory oats between two bowls. Top with turkey-spinach mixture and a fried egg. Garnish with green onions and hot sauce.

recipes.title: High-Protein Breakfast Soup
recipes.description: A warming, unconventional breakfast that packs 35g protein. This savory soup with poached eggs and white beans is perfect for cold mornings.

reheat.instructions: Reheat soup base, then poach a fresh egg to serve.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add broth, tomatoes, and Italian seasoning. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in beans and kale. Simmer 10 minutes until kale is tender.
Create 4 wells in the soup. Crack an egg into each well. Cover and cook 4-5 minutes until whites are set but yolks are still runny.
Ladle into bowls, ensuring each gets an egg. Top with parmesan, fresh basil, and black pepper. Serve with crusty bread.
